intro: Eranthemum ecbolium, commonly known as the velvetleaf eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain numerous seeds. Eranthemum ecbolium is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
